programme.title: Duchess of Cambridge: BBC Tiny Happy People
programme.desc: The Duchess of Cambridge speaks to BBC Breakfast's Louise Minchin about early years development, the gap in support given to parents before children start school, and the difficulties of life in lockdown for many families. The Duchess was speaking as part of her involvement with 'Tiny Happy People', a BBC initiative to support parents and carers in developing the language and communication skills of 0-4 year olds.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents highlights of the Premier League fixture between Norwich City and Burnley at Carrow Road.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester City. Action from the opening semi-final at Wembley Stadium, where the teams battled for a place in the final. The Citizens came out on top in this season's Premier League encounters between the teams, winning 3-0 on both occasions, most recently on 17 June as football returned to action after the lockdown.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from a regional perspective.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Sally Phillips take a look at the week's talking points and explore the ethical and religious issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Lynne Donnelly wants to move to Australia, so she takes her family for a trial week in Melbourne in the hope of convincing them to leave their home in Scotland for good.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Charles Hanson are in Oswestry, Shropshire, to help two teams look for items, while host Natasha Raskin Sharp has advice on collectibles from occupied Japan.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley finds out about the vicars of Eyam, Derbyshire, who initiated a lockdown 355 years ago to protect the rest of northern England from the bubonic plague.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore returns to transform more items reclaimed from a tip, beginning by rescuing a granite worktop from Altrincham Recycling Centre in Greater Manchester.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The third part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games - a hectic eight days in which the British gold rush continued in east London.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Tom Heap are in the Shropshire Hills to find out about an ambitious project to create a nature corridor between the two peaks of Long Mynd and Stiperstones. Tom meets a farmer who's become a convert to environmentally friendly regenerative farming, while Ellie goes in search of rare and much misunderstood wildlife. Charlotte Smith tests the strength of Britain's food supply system in the wake of the pandemic and with Brexit on the horizon.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the last-four match at Wembley Stadium. The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the historic Buckfast Abbey in Devon, where experts examine an 18th-century tankard, an iron chest with a hidden lock dating back to the 1640s, London street signs, a Biba frock, and a piece of shrapnel from the battleship Bismarck.(n)

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, featuring Bournemouth v Southampton at the Vitality Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Leicester City at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Alaska
programme.sub-title: They Couldn't Hit an Elephant from This Distance - General Sedgwick

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders: Secrets from the Square
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley is joined by Diane Parish and Tameka Empson, aka sisters Denise and Kim Fox, for a socially-distanced reunion as Tameka returns to set for the first time since 2019. The pair reveal all about their close working relationship and tell the stories behind some of their biggest moments - from Tameka reliving her infamous live labour scenes for the show's 30th anniversary to Diane explaining why she once had to pretend to all her friends and family that she'd quit the soap.(n)

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.sub-title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Cash-strapped Alison and Mike think all their problems have been solved when they inherit a grand country house, unaware that it is falling apart and teeming with the ghosts of former inhabitants. The spooks must act immediately to halt the new owners' plans to turn the house into a hotel, but their attempts to scare them away fail miserably. Comedy, starring Mathew Baynton, Simon Farnaby, Martha Howe-Douglas, Jim Howick, Laurence Rickard, Ben Willbond, Charlotte Ritchie and Kiell Smith-Bynoe.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: Agatha and Hayden attend an emotional vigil for missing baby Ben, while Megan and Jack's relationship is deteriorating under the strain. Agatha begins to panic when she realises that 'Rory' is becoming seriously unwell, but she is unwilling to seek medical help..(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: Simon brings in a friend to try to convince his two stars to put their faith in him, while Michael worries about a neighbour when he spots an ambulance outside next door. David not only manages to keep the house in order and the home-schooling ticking over in Georgia's absence, but also gets around to finishing a draft of his screenplay.(n)

programme.title: Enterprice
programme.desc: The two business partners head out on a double date, with Kazim the one in love and Jeremiah his reluctant wingman. Out of their comfort zone, they head to the East End to meet the girls, but what follows is a very strange dinner - which goes from bad to worse very quickly. Return of the comedy, starring Kayode Ewumi and Trieve Blackwood-Cambridge.(n)

programme.title: Canada's Drag Race

This time, Mo Gilligan and Anne-Marie pop by for a chat and a game of Musical VAR, and Jamie Redknapp takes on Dina Asher-Smith in The Sporting Fix. programme.desc: Time together is revealing for Ana and Ryan, and also for Renee and Mark. Kam faces a tough interview.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain

programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: In an episode originally broadcast on 27 October 1998, Pat and Peggy clash spectacularly following an accusation that Frank and Pat are having an affair behind their partners' backs. Frank searches for a missing Roy.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Kian returns to Darwin Ward, determined to make amends with Jac. But when forgiveness does not come easy, Kian goes into self-destruct mode - with almost fatal consequences. Meanwhile, a broken Essie searches for her purpose, but where will she find the answer she seeks? Ric suspects Guy has fallen off the wagon and sets out to stop him working at Holby, once and for all.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: With no money and Rory's health faltering, Agatha finds refuge in the storeroom of her old workplace. Meghan and Jack are at breaking point until Agatha takes a phone call from Hayden, who is in police custody. Laura Carmichael stars.(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: In the final episode, the play's producer decides to draft in a voice of experience to get Michael and David in line. Meanwhile, Georgia shares David's work without him knowing, and he is pleasantly surprised by the enthusiastic response his work receives, and Michael seeks resolution on what has happened to his neighbour. Comedy, starring Michael Sheen and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: How's Your Head, Hun
programme.sub-title: How's Your Head, Hun? with Michelle Visage
programme.desc: Michelle Visage welcomes comedian Keith Lemon, who chats about the appeal of crafting in a pandemic. Former footballer Alex Scott rings to inspire Michelle with her ambitious workouts, and the presenter gets on a treadmill with bestie Leah Remini.(n)

programme.title: Hayley Goes..
programme.desc: Hayley Pearce is proud of her working-class roots, but with the gap between rich and poor widening, she wants to know how easy it would be for her to move up a class. She overhauls her leisure activities with a spot of golf and some classical music, takes voice lessons to refine her accent and supercharges her table manners with an intense etiquette lesson. However, she soon discovers that there are obstacles in the way that can make social mobility very difficult.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Award-winning documentary following the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers are in Wallasey to turn Sue's concrete space into a garden fitting for the two rose bushes she planted for her late husband and mother.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jonathan Owen from Sussex arrives at the barn, bearing a small item with a big history for the attention of woodwork specialist Will Kirk. The prized possession is a hand-made model Spitfire plane, carved by Jonathan's Uncle Reggie between bombing raids over Germany. Master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher tackles the repair of a worn out and badly torn leather pouffe with precious memories for its owner Lou, silversmith Brenton West takes on the restoration of a battered silver purse and mechanical guru Steve Fletcher is faced with how to carry out the delicate repair of an old Victorian rain gauge.(n)

Crissy, Sir Matthew and Pete head to Sam's Riverside, while Judy and Riyadh go to Scully to cook for paying customers in a busy lunch service, before the contestants head back to the MasterChef kitchen to impress judges John and Gregg with their own creations.(n)
