programme.desc: Charlie Luxton is commissioned by Tara Murphy and Dimitri Daras to build a thermally efficient house on a tight budget in the Cotswolds. However, a landslide puts plans in jeopardy and he begins to think the tricky hillside plot may be more trouble that it is worth.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is Nateby Inn in Cumbria, where landlady Gaynor Walker is ready with a warm welcome. A trip to Gaynor's local brewery turns out to be a barrel of laughs when one guest beats another in a cask-rolling competition, before a broken cooker creates chaos in the kitchen the following morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Outfields Farm Bed and Breakfast in Ravensden, Bedfordshire, on their second stay, where proprietors Graham and Julia Ashley treat them to an afternoon of indoor sky-diving before hosting a dinner filled with surprises. The guests enjoy a good night's sleep, but one of the owners is expecting hassle at breakfast time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to At Home in Chiswick, west London, where artist Bob Osbourne appears to take a rather laid-back approach to running his B&B. On arrival, guests are pleasantly surprised by their first impressions of the communal living space-come-mini art gallery - but it's not long before they are dishing the dirt.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition draws to a close at the Ammonite Lodge guesthouse in Chard, Somerset, where owners Andrew and Clare Ashmore hope to excite their guests with a game of skittles. During the final dinner of the week, the competitors discuss their first impressions of each other, and Bob and Julia share some amusing observations with the group.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners confront their critics face to face, and the winners are announced. Nateby Inn host Gaynor takes issue with Graham and Julia's reduced marks for cobwebs. The conversation becomes heated when Outfields Farm's owners tackle Gaynor's complaints in return, and Georgie jumps to their defence. Artist Bob Osborne has a long list of grievances he wants to address, and Julia is left cringing when her previous comments rebound on her.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the hidden lives of the animals of Chester Zoo. The Asian elephant family welcome a new arrival. Grumpy matriarch Thi has been pregnant for almost two years and is reaching the end of her tether. She's given birth to a stillborn baby in the past, so the keepers have a close eye on her. Cameras also follow Red panda Jung, who has been getting the cold shoulder from his partner Nima since they had two cubs.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Russian blue cat is brought into the surgery with a shattered jaw after a dog attack, and a man living in a homeless shelter brings in his best friend Spud, a Labrador cross with a lame back leg. Plus, Noel tries to help straighten a deformity in a six-month-old Chihuahua puppy's leg.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Jonathan and Michael prepare for a wedding day with 45 guests. Dick's wife Angel shows some clever, cheap, wedding tips - but will Dick and the kids like them?(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Andy Stakes and Jeanette Hardy, who are building a new house on top of a sheer cliff on the west coast of Scotland. The pair want to spend £250,000 on a two-bedroom, glass-fronted and earth-sheltered home for themselves and their two beloved Newfoundland dogs. However, construction on such an exposed site is fraught with danger and the pair face no end of problems throughout the build, and a last minute design change that begs the biggest question: even if Andy finishes the house, will Jeanette actually like it?(n)

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw restore an Aston Martin DB6 for its owner, who has been prevented from working on it by a serious fall and chronic health problems.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners stay at Compton House in Newark, Nottinghamshire, which is run by Lisa Holloway - who prides herself on providing a home away from home for her visitors. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate welcome their guests to the White Horse, a pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, where they hope an afternoon of morris dancing in front of the cathedral will make a lasting impression. Unfortunately, Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked inside their room by mistake, and there are arguments over tomatoes at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Retired teachers Ed and Jane Mitchell welcome the contestants to the Old Farmhouse, Cheshire, but everyone is shocked to discover they will have to share a bathroom. Meanwhile, Sam and Ian Sugden find an unwelcome surprise underneath their bed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day arrives, as the guests gather to find out who has won and to thrash out their differences - from some fishy findings to a reminder of why sorry can be the hardest word. Later on, a heated exchange about cleaning ends in tears.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester's Penguin Island is home to one of the most enduring love stories in the zoo. At 22, Rud is the oldest on the island, and has been with his partner, Spike, for over 15 years. However, keepers are concerned that Rud's arthritic hip could be affecting his quality of life. Meanwhile, the Sumatran tigers are upgrading to a luxury new enclosure on the other side of the zoo as part of Chester's huge expansion. But they've lived in their home for most of their lives so it's not going to be an easy move.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Senior neurologist Dr Colin Driver comes up with an unconventional solution to treat a nurse's cat, which has been rushed into the surgery after being poisoned. The owners of a rare Polish sheepdog with a failed fracture repair on a broken leg are faced with the option of having the leg removed, or trying an innovative total elbow replacement. Plus, a self-confessed 'crazy cat lady' brings in a ginger tom which urgently needs leg surgery.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge helps Donna McDougal, who believes a horde of ancient armour was hidden in her chateau's lake. programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of musician Toby Leeming as he sets out to build a house wrapped around an ancient oak tree in rural Suffolk. The design for Toby's five-building home contains six bedrooms, six bathrooms, a music studio and an annexe - a vast project more like a village than a house. Creating this life changing vision on a £530k budget, and in only eight months, will not be an easy task, especially as they must build up close to an ancient oak without destroying any of the roots.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Cardiff's Edwardian past, discovering how the coal industry transformed the Rhondda Valley in the early 1900s. She investigates the difficult and often dangerous work of the miners, and visits the trading floor where the first ever million pound cheque was signed. The programme also investigates how global shipping routes and plentiful employment brought immigrants from across the world to Wales, and meets descendants of people who came to the city in the early years of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

programme.desc: The contestants arrive at the Trafford in Blackpool, owned by Robbie and John Welling, who are proud of their traditional 'bucket and spade' B&B. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Host Julie welcomes the contestants to Sheepy Lodge, Warwickshire, where they are shocked by their surroundings, and disappointed by a variety of things in the rooms. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Heyford House in Oxfordshire, where Leo and Sonya Brooke-Little hope to impress the contestants with their hospitality. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock Burgius sees as the perfect opportunity to settle some scores with his fellow competitors.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's winner is announced as the B&B owners meet for the last time to thrash out their differences. Feedback includes criticism of a badly positioned tea tray, controversy over a hot chocolate and accusations of overenthusiastic hosting.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The Hi Way elephants have been hit with a potentially deadly virus, with the youngest members of the family most at risk, and the keepers and Chester Zoo's veterinary team do all they can to combat the mysterious illness. Meanwhile, Mac the stallion zebra is introduced to the zoo's three mares in the hope they will produce much needed offspring for this endangered species. Plus, a rescue dog with deformed front legs is brought into the surgery.(n)

Meanwhile, sisters Tanya and Marian prepare to visit their chateau in the Loire Valley. programme.title: Grand Designs

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain looking for items to fix up and flog on behalf of their owners. In this episode they're close to the Malvern Hills. Henry picks two saddles from horse owner Sabrina and converts them into bar stools, while Simon makes a handsome profit on a 1960s kitchen cupboard.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: In the Pays de la Loire, twenty-something couple Billy and Gwendoline want to open their chateau as a wedding location, but it's not going to plan as the chimney seems to have caught fire. Near Dijon, Clive and Tanith run an upmarket chateau hotel but need to win over the locals, so they put on an open day. Meanwhile, sisters Tanya and Marian prepare to visit their chateau in the Loire Valley. They need to get it ready for the first guests of the summer in less than a week's time, but are faced with everything from dead flies to leaking swimming pools.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton heads to Devon to help some turkey farmers who are desperate to finally put a proper roof over their kids' heads. After a decade living in makeshift accommodation, Daniel and Elaine Mason are building a family home on the family farm, but Charlie's worried the budget won't keep pace with their architectural ambition. The designs look complicated and costly, and when the first bills come in, his worst fears are realised.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Anglesey, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to show that Blackthorn Farm B&B, which they own, is better than any of their guests' establishments. However, they find that their close friendship is scrutinised even more than their property.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire, is the second stop of the competition, and owners Graham and Barbara Yellow hope their basic facilities and affordable prices will please their guests. Spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from their room, Rachel Lonergan views the hosts in a new light and breakfast is well received by the contestants, despite having to pay a supplement fee.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Vegetarians Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor host at the Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset, and both come under attack at dinner when Malcolm voices his opinions on meat eating. In the morning, a meditation session gets a mixed response, and most of the guests are left cold by the vegetarian buffet breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Rachel and Dan Lonergan welcome their guests to the Brighton Inn, East Sussex, where they hope to offer a luxury, boutique experience. Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor give their room a thorough inspection, before the groups learns the art of building a human pyramid in the afternoon's activity. At breakfast, they discover a lack of vegetarian alternatives, and the hosts suspect game-playing when they are shocked by some negative feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their rivals and find out how much they have been paid. Richard and Susan are keen to tackle the bathroom issues of Barbara and Graham, who bask in the comments from Malcolm and Fiona. The Old Mill House proprietors defend their vegetarian breakfast routine, but serve up snobby feedback to Rachel and Dan from the Brighton Inn.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow Chester Zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins who are being brought up apart from the main colony until they're old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They're keen to make a break for it and join the adults, but when they're finally free to go they have other ideas. Elsewhere, Niall the chimpanzee keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years. When the ape captures a moorhen chick, Niall must use his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick performs a risky procedure to save the life of an 18-week-old cockapoo puppy that has fractured its neck following an accident in the garden. He also comes to the aid of Romanian stray Geoffrey, who was found abandoned and emaciated before being adopted by Kent couple John and Stacey, and an accident-prone cat called MK who has fallen from a window.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Billy, Gwendoline and Michael locate their heating problem, but it means that Billy - who's scared of height - has to repoint the chimney 20 metres up. Clive and Tanith get their hands dirty trying to work out what's stopped the fountain working at their hotel and Michelin-starred restaurant. Meanwhile, the clock's ticking for sisters Marian and Tanya as they try to sort out a winter's worth of problems.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Gallery owner Elinor and fitness entrepreneur Born set themselves the task of creating Britain's first hypoallergenic house in a leafy back garden plot in south-west London. Driven by the need to alleviate their two young sons' life-threatening allergies, their new part-submerged, shed-inspired home, will be constructed using low toxin materials and deploy cutting-edge filtration systems to clean the air they breathe. Will their innovative new house deliver the benefits Elinor and Born are hoping for?(n)

programme.title: Code 37: Sex Crimes
programme.desc: When Pieter, a gigolo, is raped during one of his client sessions, Hannah and her team have no idea where to start as Pieter does not believe it was the usual client, so assess his regulars hoping for a break before things escalate. Meanwhile, Hannah gets another tip that could lead to a breakthrough in her private investigation. Belgian crime thriller, starring Veerle Baetens and Gilles De Schryver. In Flemish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The department treats a 31-year-old biker who was involved in a head-on collision, and a teenager left with injuries to his hand after punching through a window. Plus, Resus team members struggle to revive two elderly patients, and discuss what they would want done for them in a similar situation.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff of King's College Hospital in London face a busy day dealing with brain injuries, including 65-year-old cabbie Charlie Brown, whom doctors worry has suffered a haemorrhage in a car accident, and 89-year-old Peggy Pierce, who has been rushed in following a suspected stroke. In the waiting room, a woman is comforted by her ex-boyfriend while she awaits treatment for a cut finger.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In this revisit episode, chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to Mojito, the Junction (formerly known as Flamangos) and Bazzini to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress?(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton heads to Devon to help some turkey farmers who are desperate to finally put a proper roof over their kids' heads. After a decade living in makeshift accommodation, Daniel and Elaine Mason are building a family home on the family farm, but Charlie's worried the budget won't keep pace with their architectural ambition. The designs look complicated and costly, and when the first bills come in, his worst fears are realised.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The department treats a 31-year-old biker who was involved in a head-on collision, and a teenager left with injuries to his hand after punching through a window. Plus, Resus team members struggle to revive two elderly patients, and discuss what they would want done for them in a similar situation.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: A sense of dread descends on Craggy Island as the priests prepare for poker-faced Father Stone's annual visit - and Ted tries desperately to think of a scheme to get rid of him. Clerical comedy, starring Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt investigates concerns about levels of naturally occurring arsenic in baby rice products, Jimmy Doherty examines Marks & Spencer's claim that they can trace all their beefburgers back to the cow, and Kate Quilton find out whether a parasite could be hiding in sushi. Programme exploring the secrets behind mass-produced food, meeting technicians, scientists, factory owners, growers and producers to find out exactly what goes into the groceries that end up on the supermarket shelves.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: London couple Bob and Annette Roberts have been holidaying in Grenada for 25 years and now, with retirement on the horizon, they're looking to invest £225,000 in a holiday home. Adrian Simpson shows them round a selection of what is available on the market.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Adrian Simpson shows Deborah and Peter Merritt a selection of properties for sale in Tobago. The couple downsized in the UK, and have decided to invest £300,000 in a holiday home on the breathtaking Caribbean island close to Trinidad.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Adrian Simpson meets Colin and Veronica Moore, who want a holiday home in St Lucia where they can escape the British winters, so he searches the Caribbean island for properties on a budget of £200,000.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Bath, Kirstie Allsopp meets first time buyers Laura and Phil, who are desperate to make the move from shared living to a home of their own. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer goes property searching with downsizing duo Kerrie and Dave, who sold their beloved barn conversion to move closer to their kids.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: The semi-finals have arrived, with four teams battling for a place in the final, with the challenges including five hours to create a magical Charlotte Russe display, while at the same time preparing all of the elements needed to perform a spectacular, World of Magic-inspired piece of gourmet theatre, known as live plating. At the end of the challenge, the teams have just three minutes to transform their table into a gastronomic work of illusion and theatre, under the tough gaze of judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gemma Willock hosts the first party in the West Midlands, and her evening of glitz and glamour looks set to be a roaring success until an unwelcome revelation about her corner-cutting approach to the competition threatens her chances of taking the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mortgage adviser Andrew Devey throws the second party in the West Midlands, hosting a beatnik-themed evening. He cooks shepherd's pie for his main course, as well as lining up some pop art in the hope that it will expand his guests' minds.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vegetarian Jules Evans hosts the third day of the competition in the West Midlands, and plans to indulge her passion for historical re-enactments by planning a medieval-themed dinner. The guests offer mixed responses when they look at the menu, but things take a turn for the better when she announces a duel will form part of the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Massage therapist Lucy Hird hosts the fourth dinner party from the West Midlands, featuring an extensive menu full of Thai specialities. She also gives individual presents to her guests, but her night is compromised by the entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mental-health nurse Lloyd Cast hosts the final dinner party from the West Midlands. Despite appearing to be an extrovert so far, he decides on a chilled theme for the evening to allow his food to take centre stage, before the winner of the £1,000 is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Golf House on the Isle of Wight, where hosts John and Sue Blakemore hope to impress their guests during their stay. Things start off positively with a well-received breakfast, but a suspicious stain in a toilet causes controversy among some of the competitors.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to St John's Wood, north-west London, where Nick Tyrie and his friend Layla Amini welcome their guests to the New Inn Pub. One of the proprietors tries to win points by revealing her musical past, but John and Sue Blakemore feel their room is too impersonal, and are underwhelmed by the choices at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Bunkroom hostel in Chester, David Sharrock is determined to prove that hostelling is for everybody - even if his wife Victoria isn't convinced. It's bunkbeds and budget breakfasts for all, as his fellow hosts decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group heads to John Graham's the B&B in Blackpool for the final visit of the week, and an afternoon of tenpin bowling brings out the guests' competitive sides. Later, there is more tension at the dinner table when the host is subjected to aggressive questioning by John and Sue Blakemore.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the guest house owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Lauren and Christian Grant in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, who are unsure whether to sell or upgrade their house. Christian dreams of a home bursting with character, but Lauren thinks that they can refurbish their four-bedroom detached property to make it more suitable for them and their two small children.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients dealt with at King's College Hospital, London include a man who was stabbed in his own home and has injuries to his lung, arm and liver, and an elderly woman injured in a fall. A former international lawyer who lost his wife, family and home to alcoholism decides to make a change after being treated with care and compassion.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 77-year-old former motorbike racer arrives with a potentially deadly swelling of the main artery that could burst at any moment. His only option is major surgery, which could be dangerous at his age. A woman whose boyfriend was killed in a cycling accident a year previously is also injured while on her bike, and a medical technician and a mobile caterer talk about their roles in aiding people to recovery.(n)

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Thoroughly Modern Millican Live
programme.desc: Stand-up performance, recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo during the comedienne's 2012 UK tour. Anecdotes include life's humdrum curiosities, the wonders of making a home-made treadmill, the reasons for carrying spare pants and the practicalities of an orgy.(n)

programme.title: PL Greatest Games
programme.desc: West Bromwich Albion v Manchester United from 2013.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Pritchett-Dunphy-Tuckers board the train for an eventful journey to Dede's wedding. Claire and Mitchell work on their speech, Phil and Cam are starstruck when they spot their favourite author on the train, Manny and Luke go girl crazy and Gloria finds herself stuck in a frustrating situation. Meanwhile, Jay seems delighted that Dede has moved on for good, but could his overenthusiasm come back to bite him?(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire struggles to find the right moment to sack an employee, while Phil catches Luke in a compromising position at home and everyone fails to notice that Alex has moved back for the summer. Elsewhere, Jay refuses to accept that finding a job again might be harder than he thought and Lily gets caught in the middle when Cameron and Mitch decide to spend the summer apart.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The American comedy returns with all three families trying to cope with their separate holiday experiences, before everyone tries to make their way back home in time for Father's Day. The Dunphys are wrapping up their trip to New York City, while Cam and Mitchell are caring for Cam's dying grandmother in Missouri, and Jay, Gloria and Manny are attending a wedding in Mexico - but all of their respective trips are thrown into turmoil.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay tries to make a good impression on his new neighbours, while Cam and Mitchell attempt to teach Lily a message of acceptance.(n)

programme.title: Magnum P.I
programme.desc: As their wedding day approaches, Thomas and Higgins help a woman who stole illicit drugs inadvertently while thinking she was helping a school obtain much-needed supplies. Rick assists a retired soldier with the difficult task of re-entering the work force as a civilian.(n)

programme.title: Magnum P.I
programme.desc: Thomas and Higgins find themselves on opposite sides when they are each hired separately by spouses in the middle of a contentious divorce.(n)

programme.title: Magnum P.I
programme.desc: Rick's father figure Icepick, just out of prison and battling terminal cancer, gets double-crossed on one last score. Meanwhile, Thomas makes one last bold move to help Higgins stay in the country.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is possessed by an evil toupee, Bart and Lisa get trapped inside an Itchy & Scratchy cartoon, and Maggie is found to be the spawn of aliens. Featuring the guest voices of talk show host Jerry Springer and Robert Englund as murderous villain Freddy Krueger.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: When You Dish Upon a Star
programme.desc: Homer befriends holidaying Hollywood stars and promises to keep their whereabouts a secret - but cannot resist telling the gang at Moe's about his new celebrity friends. With the guest voices of Kim Basinger, Alec Baldwin and Ron Howard.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer discovers his long-lost mother was a free-spirited hippie and decides to follow in her footsteps, throwing off the shackles of conformity and becoming a drop-out dedicated to the pursuit of peace and free love.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: On an eventful tour of Italy in Mr Burns' new car, Homer, Marge and the kids encounter Sideshow Bob (guest star Kelsey Grammer), who begs them not to reveal his criminal past. Unfortunately for him, Lisa lets the cat out of the bag.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The body of a long-lost postman is found in a tree, with a mailbag containing a 40-year-old letter for Grandma Simpson. It reveals she had an affair around the time of Homer's conception, causing him to doubt whether Grampa is really his biological father. With the voices of Michael York, Joe Frazier and William H Macy.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: We're on the Road to D'ohwhere
programme.desc: Homer is forced to drive Bart to a discipline camp in another state, meaning he has to miss out on a trip to Las Vegas with Moe and the gang. While they are away, Marge decides to hold a yard sale - but ends up getting arrested as a suspected drug dealer.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Groundskeeper Willie is made homeless and forced to move in with the family, giving Lisa the idea of trying to transform him into a gentleman. Meanwhile, Homer embarks on a campaign to save the company that manufactures his favourite blue trousers.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer gets trapped in a cave after trying to acquire a piece of stalactite during a family walk, leaving Marge, Maggie and Bart to go in search of help. As they wait, Lisa passes the time by telling her father a long and very strange tale in which she seeks refuge at Mr Burns' mansion.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: The 2020 Hungarian Grand Prix. Highlights of the third round of the season, which was held at the Hungaroring.(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter: A Who's Who of the Wizarding World
programme.desc: Alex Zane checks out the greatest witches, wizards, Muggles and magical creatures in the movie franchise, from He Who Must Not Be Named to the boy wizard himself.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge offers to babysit Ned Flanders' boys so he can attend a left-handers' convention. Meanwhile, Homer takes the Simpson children to an animal retirement home - where Bart has the misfortune to be kidnapped by a lonely chimpanzee.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Homer Simpson, This Is Your Wife
programme.desc: In an episode written by Ricky Gervais, who provides the voice of a would-be ladies' man, Homer's obsession with Lenny's new plasma TV leaves him desperate to buy one of his own, so he signs up for a wife-swapping show to win the money. Unfortunately, Marge's new 'husband' soon develops a crush on her.(n)

programme.title: Greg Davies: The Back of My Mum's Head
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy with the Man Down star, recorded at the Lowry in Salford. Stung by his mother's suggestion that he is 'not normal', Greg puts everyone else under the microscope in a petty quest to discover if anyone actually is. The tour received rave reviews and was extended to 94 dates, including multiple sell-out nights at London's Hammersmith Apollo and Southbank Centre.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own: European Road Trip
programme.desc: Jamie Redknapp and Andrew Flintoff head to Monaco, where Novak Djokovic is waiting to umpire a doubles match with Josh Widdicombe and Geri Horner.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The Proactive Squad from Thames Valley Police uses unmarked cars with video cameras on board to give an intriguing insight into car crime and ways it can be prevented. Featuring footage of dangerous drivers on the overcrowded roads.(n)

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: The Task Force investigates a series of attacks on data centres by a blacklister who has an unusual condition. Meanwhile, Glen tries to prove his value after a shipping mishap.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Kensi and Deeks go undercover at a decommissioned nuclear plant when they investigate the radiation poisoning of a marine moonlighting as a security guard at the installation.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A dead body falls on to a 4x4 belonging to none other than reality TV star Dog the Bounty Hunter (making a brief guest appearance) and the ensuing investigation leads the team to the local roller derby - so Catherine puts her skates on in an attempt to find a killer. Meanwhile, Doris has a run-in with a burglar who makes off with a box containing details of her entire black ops career. Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan and Christine Lahti co-star.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The team from the Proactive Elite Unit investigates Russian scam artists, a dangerous road user, tank joyriders and a man riding a mini-motorbike.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: On-board video cameras in police cars capture footage of officers in Reading engaging in a high-speed pursuit of a stolen vehicle and others in Aylesbury staking out a suspected drug deal.(n)

programme.title: Animal 999
programme.desc: Pilot whales are in danger of becoming beached on South Uist, horses risk being poisoned by the toxic ragwort weed, and inspectors check everything is in order at a farming show. More behind-the-scenes insights at the Scottish SPCA as cameras follow the work of its officers.(n)

programme.title: Animal 999
programme.desc: SPCA staff try to build up an emaciated seal's strength to the point where it is well enough to rejoin its family in the sea, and three baby hedgehogs fight for life at the Penicuik centre.(n)

programme.title: RSPCA Animal Rescue
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of RSPCA officers in Australia as they help animals in need.(n)

programme.title: RSPCA Animal Rescue
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of RSPCA officers in Australia as they help animals in need.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Barry and the team discover that Captain Cold has been kidnapped and form an uneasy alliance with his sister Lisa, but the superhero feels betrayed when he later finds out Cold is gearing up to pull off a heist with his father Lewis. Meanwhile, Joe finds himself faced with a difficult decision.(n)

programme.title: Supergirl
programme.desc: A new vigilante known as the Guardian lends a hand after a parasitic alien drains Kara of her powers, while Mon-El considers a less than desirable new career and Alex struggles with a new reality.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer accidentally saves Mayor Quimby from a rioting mob and is appointed his official bodyguard, but finds himself up against local gangster Fat Tony. Featuring the guest voice of Mark Hamill (Star Wars).(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer takes Ned Flanders to Las Vegas, where they go on a drunken binge at a casino and wake up with hangovers to find themselves married to sleazy, gold-digging cocktail waitresses. Featuring the guest voices of the Moody Blues.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Deeks is arrested and placed behind bars after he is accused of murdering his former partner, and it is left to the rest of the team to find a way to prove his innocence. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell, LL Cool J and Eric Christian Olsen.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A suspected North Korean spy is poisoned and hit by a truck carrying Christmas trees. and it is up to the NCIS team to investigate who has been smuggling secret agents into America. Meanwhile, Deeks and Kensi try to find a way to incorporate their mothers into their festive plans, and Hetty notices that Grainger doesn't seem to be getting into the holiday spirit. Starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and Danny score prime tickets for the NFL Pro Bowl, only for their plans to be derailed by the murder of an executive - whose drink was spiked by a powerful sedative - at a bar also attended by one of the players - real-life American football star Arian Foster. Does the player know anything about the incident? US crime drama, starring Alex O'Loughlin and Scott Caan.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The owners of a tour company accused of endangering the local shark population fall victim to a string of arson attacks - but the persecution turns deadly with the discovery of an employee's body at the bottom of a submerged shark cage. On a less grisly note, Kamekona hones his helicopter flight simulation skills in the hope of securing a pilot's licence.(n)

programme.title: Brit Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Wiltshire are out in force on the M4 to track down drug-dealers.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Pritchetts go head-to-head when Luke decides his best chance at getting into college is to run for senior class president against Manny. Phil insists on introducing Haley to marketing guru Merv Schechter (guest star Martin Short), while Cam makes a rash decision when he finds out his star football player is moving away.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is unable to hide his excitement when he's invited to appear in a real-estate segment for the local news and the day gets even better after meeting his weatherman hero Rainer Shine (guest star Nathan Fillion). Meanwhile, Jay decides to infuse a little grit into Manny's video interview for his college application, and Lily decides to take matters into her own hands over her new house guest.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge offers to babysit Ned Flanders' boys so he can attend a left-handers' convention. Meanwhile, Homer takes the Simpson children to an animal retirement home - where Bart has the misfortune to be kidnapped by a lonely chimpanzee.(n)

programme.title: Live MNF
programme.sub-title: Brighton & Hove Albion v Newcastle United
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Newcastle United (Kick-off 6.00pm). Coverage of the Premier League contest at AMEX Stadium. This has been a low-scoring fixture in recent seasons, with neither side having scored more than one goal against their opponent in the last five meetings. Three of those games ended in a stalemate, including the reverse fixture last September, which produced a 0-0 draw at St James' Park.(n)

programme.title: Twister
programme.desc: A storm-chaser and her estranged husband are brought together in a joint project to monitor the path of an oncoming tornado - but the pair face a race against the clock as a rival government-backed group with hi-tech resources tries to beat them to it. Action thriller, starring Helen Hunt, Bill Paxton, Cary Elwes, Jami Gertz and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Condor
programme.desc: While travelling through Europe, Joe is approached by a Russian intelligence officer who offers to reveal the identity of a mole in exchange for protection. Spy thriller, starring Max Irons.(n)

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: Police hunt for a man wanted for domestic violence, while a tip-off leads to a drugs raid and an uninsured driver gives officers the runaround.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The body of a teenage girl who was kidnapped 10 years previously is discovered in the woods - just as the perpetrator strikes again and takes another youngster hostage. Meanwhile, Kono asks Catherine a favour, aware it could damage her relationship with Adam. Crime drama, starring Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan, Grace Park, Henry Rollins and Don Swayze.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The team from the Proactive Elite Unit investigates Russian scam artists, a dangerous road user, tank joyriders and a man riding a mini-motorbike.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part one of two. In order to locate Arkady Kolcheck, the NCIS team goes undercover with his daughter Anna at a gala in Los Angeles to gain access to the Russian consul general's computer.(n)

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The Planet Express gang travels back in time to 1999 via Fry's dreams to decipher the meaning behind a mysterious alien melody. With the guest voices of Family Guy creator Seth MacFarlane and comedy actress Sarah Silverman.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fry gets angry with Bender for taking his toothbrush to shine his metallic backside, and before long tempers flare between the Planet Express crew. programme.title: Animal 999
programme.desc: The Scottish SPCA goes to the rescue of a seal pup that is stranded on a beach. Plus, staff check up on a Jack Russell terrier that is suffering from a huge tumour.(n)

programme.title: Animal 999

programme.title: Supergirl
programme.desc: Guardian tries to clear his name after being accused of a murder committed by another vigilante, while Kara heads out on a solo mission to rescue Mon-El from the clutches of CADMUS, but comes face-to-face with a cyborg Hank Henshaw.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Springfield Elementary is damaged by vandals, prompting Chief Wiggum to enforce a curfew - but the kids rebel by sneaking out to see a late-night horror film. Featuring the guest voice of Cyndi Lauper.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer organises a trip to the Super Bowl with a busload of friends and acquaintances - but unfortunately for all concerned, his tickets turn out to be forgeries. With the guest voices of Rupert Murdoch, Dolly Parton, John Madden and Dan Marino.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a tech entrepreneur turned venture capitalist who secretly developed a computer program that allows for undetectable data collection.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Kensi announces she and Deeks are moving in together just as they are assigned the task of protecting a witness, who happens to be her ex-fiance Jack.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Imi Loko Ka 'Uhane (See Within One's Soul)
programme.desc: McGarrett and Danny aren't impressed when a talk-show host and her crew follow Five-0 around for a few days. programme.desc: Documentary series which follows a rapid response team of police officers as they tackle crime.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Live Premier League
programme.desc: Watford v Manchester City (Kick-off 6.00pm). If the reverse fixture is anything to go by they could be in for a tough evening, having lost 8-0 at Etihad Stadium last September, with Bernardo Silva claiming a hat-trick.(n)

programme.title: Rob & Romesh Vs
programme.desc: Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan learn about the sport, a journey that takes them from the street courts of Los Angeles to the Staples Center, the home of professional teams the LA Lakers and the LA Clippers.(n)

programme.title: Condor
programme.desc: Joe makes a new discovery while chasing the mole, and also comes to the realisation he is not the only one with a possible lead. Spy thriller, starring Max Irons.(n)

programme.title: Karl Pilkington: The Moaning of Life
programme.desc: Karl ends his journey with a look at differing attitudes to death. He visits Ghana, where he shops for a customised coffin, before attending his first-ever funeral and the accompanying parade.
